This is a conditional statement, where the antecedent is "the bear was in the cave" and the consequent is "the wolf was in the den". The second premise states that the bear was not in the cave. This is a negation of the antecedent of the conditional statement. Using modus tollens, we can infer that the wolf was not in the den, as the consequent of the conditional statement is negated.
